subject: Re: [cc-devel] Embedded License Format, OO.org
body:
Hello Jason,As far as I know, the way to append meta-data for an openoffice element is using "user defined attributes" in meta.xml. For example:<meta:user-defined meta:name="License Name">Attribution-ShareAlike 
2.5 </meta:user-defined><meta:user-defined meta:name="License URL">http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.5/</meta:user-defined>
...I would like to append meta-data as a child element of <office:meta> element, but I think there's no easy way to do this, I'm still checking it. The ideal scenario would be if CC RDF was in ODF specification.
I'll keep you updated, but don't delay your project, there is a lot of discussion and work to be done regarding this question yet. =)Best,CassioOn 6/11/07, 
François Déchelle <

francois@dechelle.net
> wrote:Hello,No, the way to add license metadata to OO.o ODF documents has not been
decided yet, but it has to be decided for the OO.o extension. We'll postit as soon as there is a decision on this point.FrançoisJason Kivlighn a écrit :> Hey Cassio,>> My SoC project is extracting license metadata for Tracker, and so I'll
> be extracting metadata from OpenOffice documents.  Has the form of the> license metadata in OO files been decided yet?  When I get this, I can> start working on extracting this metadata (No hurry... there's plenty of
> other formats to pin down).  When available, a post to the mailing list> or techblog  outlining this would be very useful.>> Cheers,> Jason
